article.p:
April 2, 2020 3pm
Irvington Community Schools will begin eLearning on Monday, April 6. ICS leadership and staff have spent the last several weeks preparing by refining curriculum, engaging new technology, and finalizing lesson plans. We look forward to providing your student with high-quality interactive instruction. To ensure a successful start to eLearning, ICS staff created an “ICS At-Home Guide to eLearning.” The Guide is available by clicking the button below or visiting the ICS website HERE. Please take a moment to review the document BEFORE Monday, April 6.

In previous messages, ICS Leadership communicated that eLearning would continue through May 1. However, with today’s announcement by Indiana’s Superintendent of Public Instruction, Dr. Jennifer McCormick, and new orders issued by Gov. Eric Holcomb, all K-12 public and non-public schools will remain closed for the duration of this school year. Thus, ICS eLearning will continue through Friday, June 5, the last day of the 2019-2020 school year. As this is an extremely new development (4/2/20 – 2:30 p.m.), ICS will share additional information and status updates in the next several weeks as to how this will impact the remainder of the school year.

Listed below are a number of reminders and resources specific to school operations and academics. As well, we are passing along helpful COVID-19 precautionary information. Thanks to all ICS students and families who continue to extend patience, understanding and support in this unprecedented time.

p.br: Irvington Community Schools is on Spring Break through Friday, April 3. Note that leadership and staff are continuing to monitor new developments related to COVID-19 and the impact on ICS.
All ICS buildings are officially closed until further notice.

Irvington Community Schools will begin eLearning on Monday, April 6. Throughout the duration of eLearning, teachers and staff will be available via email, Google Voice, or Google Meets daily, Monday – Friday, 9 a.m. – 3 p.m. Please make sure you are reaching out if you have questions or need other assistance. Also, please be sure to thoroughly read the “ICS At-Home Guide to eLearning” by clicking the link below, or visiting the ICS eLearning resource page HERE. Please look for additional information (e-mail) from your student’s principal on Friday, April 3.

article.p: As a reminder, families who do not have access to Internet service may find the resources below helpful in preparation for Monday, April 6.
ICS has extended its WiFi access points at each building. Please see below for specifics:

ICES campus | Families should be able to park in the two curb lanes of the parking lot along the building between the grades 3-5 entrance and the gym entrance to pick up the campus WiFi signal; further from the building will result in less connectivity.

ICMS campus | Families can park in the seven or so parking spots closest to the building in the northwest upper paved lot behind the school. Access to connection points may also be reached from the outdoor classroom area. Please remember to respect the social distancing recommendation of six feet from each other.

IPA campus | Families can connect to WiFi using the staff parking lot on the southwest side of the building (west entrance off of E. University Avenue). As a reminder, a stronger signal will be accessible closer to the building. Additionally, when maintaining recommended social distancing guidelines (six feet), WiFi connection can be enabled anywhere within the courtyard area on the south side of the building.

span.strong: Internet Providers Participating in Free Internet Service

article.p:
AT&T Access (https://m.att.com/shopmobile/internet/access/)
(families will need to apply and be qualified, similar requirements as those of the federal Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program [SNAP])

Comcast /Xfinity (https://www.internetessentials.com)
(families will need to apply and be qualified, similar requirements as SNAP)

Spectrum (p: 1-844-488-8395)
(free Internet service for anyone with a K-12 /college student at their address)

p.br: Starting Monday, April 6, Irvington Community Schools, in partnership with Aramark, will provide FREE meals to school-aged children. Meal pick-up is available ONLY at Irvington Preparatory Academy, 5751 University Ave., two days weekly (Mondays and Thursdays, 7:30 – 8:30 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m.) Monday pick-ups will provide breakfast and lunch for three days (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday) and Thursday pick-ups will provide breakfast and lunch for two days (Thursday, Friday). Meals will be distributed via drive-through service at IPA’s gym doors located at the building’s east entrance.

Access to the four ICS Little Free Lending Libraries is available to all ICS students and families. ICS staff and volunteers have increased efforts restocking the libraries on a regular basis. Note that reading materials in all four libraries are suitable for ALL ages, including adults. With the continued closing of the Indianapolis Public Library, this is one small way we can ensure your family (and the Irvington community) has access to books, magazines and other reading material. As a reminder, please be sure to practice social distancing when accessing the libraries.
Note below the highlighted healthcare precautions as a quick reference to doing your part in mitigating the impact of this worldwide pandemic:

ul.li: Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.
Practice social distancing. Maintain at least 6 feet of distance between yourself and those around you.
Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth.

Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.

article.p: If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance.

hr.div: COVID-19 — ICS Status, Updates March 20, 2020

Indiana Gov. Eric Holcomb announced Thursday, March 19, all K-12 public and non-public schools will remain closed until May 1, 2020, amid the coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak. Given these orders, Irvington Community Schools will begin eLearning on Monday, April 6, 2020. (As a reminder, ICS will be out of session/closed for Spring Break beginning Monday, March 23, through Sunday, April 5.)

School leadership will continue to issue communications and status updates throughout the next two weeks to ensure a smooth transition to eLearning on Monday, April 6. Additionally, listed below are a number of reminders and resources specific to school operations and academic resources. As well, we are passing along helpful COVID-19 precautions. Thanks to all ICS students and families who continue to extend patience, understanding and support in this unprecedented time.

ICS Spring Break: Irvington Community Schools is on Spring Break Monday, March 23 – Friday, April 3. Note that leadership and staff will be monitoring new developments related to COVID-19 and the impact on ICS. We appreciate your understanding as communications may decrease slightly during the first week of break (March 23 – March 27). Please plan for delayed response time from teachers, school leaders and our social media team.
BUILDING ACCESS: All ICS buildings are officially closed until further notice.

ICS eLEARNING: Irvington Community Schools will begin eLearning on Monday, April 6. Please look to receive additional communications regarding this step during the week of March 30. Meanwhile, families who do not have access to Internet service may find the resources below helpful in preparation for Monday, April 6.

div.span: Internet Providers Participating in Free or Low Cost Internet Service

hr.div: Comcast /Xfinity (https://www.internetessentials.com)
(families will need to apply and be qualified, similar requirements as SNAP)
(Free Internet service for anyone with a K-12 /college student at their address)

Upon the launch of eLearning, ICS will extend the WiFi access points to reach various points at each building. Please see below for specifics: ICES Building | Families should be able to park in the two curb lanes of the parking lot along the building between the grades 3-5 entrance and the gym entrance to pick up the campus WiFi signal; further from the building will result in less connectivity.

ICMS Building | Families can park in the seven or so parking spots closest to the building in the northwest upper paved lot behind the school. Access to connection points may also be experienced from the outdoor classroom area. Please remember to respect the social distancing recommendation of six feet from each other.

IPA Building | Families can connect to WiFi using the staff parking lot on the southwest side of the building (west entrance off of E. University Avenue). As a reminder, a stronger signal will be accessible closer to the building. Additionally, when maintaining recommended social distancing guidelines (six feet), WiFi connection can be enabled anywhere within the courtyard area on the south side of the building.

FOOD SERVICE: ICS is working with the Indiana Department of Education and our food service provider, Aramark, to see if we can continue with breakfast and lunch meal service during Spring Break. If this is possible, we will send out notice to all ICS families as soon as possible.

COVID-19 PRECAUTIONS: Please continue to monitor the World Health Organization (WHO) for the most up-to-date information regarding COVID-19 (https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019). Note the below highlighted precautions as a quick reference to doing our part in mitigating the impact of this world-wide pandemic:
● Regularly and thoroughly clean your hands with an alcohol-based hand rub or wash them with soap and water.
● Maintain at least 6 feet of distance between yourself and anyone who is coughing or sneezing.
● Avoid touching eyes, nose and mouth.

● Make sure you, and the people around you, follow good respiratory hygiene. This means covering your mouth and nose with your bent elbow or tissue when you cough or sneeze. Then dispose of the used tissue immediately.
● Stay home!
● if you feel unwell. If you have a fever, cough and difficulty breathing, seek medical attention and call in advance.
Please know you and your student(s) are VALUED members of our ICS family. We look forward to continued communication in the coming weeks. Stay well, Ravens!

div.p: El jueves, el 19 de marzo, el gobernador de Indiana, Eric Holcomb anuncio que todas las escuelas en Indiana publicas y privadas permanceran cerradas hasta el primero de mayo, 2020, en medio del brote de coronavirus (COVID-10). Debido a estas ordenes, Irvington Community Schools comenzaran a aprender virtual (eLearning) el lunes, el 6 de abril, 2020. (Como recordatorio, ICS esta cerrado para vacaciones de primavera el 23 de marzo hasta el 5 de abril.) El liderazgo escolar continuara emitiendo comunicaciones y actualizaciones de estado durante las proximas dos semanas para asegurar una transicion sauve a eLearning el lunes el 6 de abril. Ademas, se enumeran a continuaction una serie de recursos y recordatorios especificos de las operaciones de las escuelas y recursos academicos. Tambien hay precuaciones utiles sobre COVID-19. Gracia as todos los estudiantes y familias de ICS a quien continuamente ofrecen paciencia, entendimiento, y apoyo durante este tiempo sin precedentes.

ICS Spring Break: Irvington Community Schools estan en vacaciones de primavera lunes el 23 del marzo-viernes el 3 de abril. Note que el liderazgo y el personal estaran monitoreando nuevos desarrollos relacionados a COVID-19 y el impacto en ICS. Apreciamos su comprension ya que las comunicaciones pueden disminuir ligeramente durante la primera semana de vacaciones (el 23 del marzo-el 27 del marzo). Por favor, planeen para un tiempo de respuesta retrasado de los profesores, el liderazgo, y nuestro equipo de media social.
Accesso a los edificios: Todas las escueals oficialmente estan cerradas hasta nuevo aviso.

ELearning de ICS: ICS va a empezar eLearning el lunes, el 6 de abril. Por favor, esperan recibir mas comunicaciones sobre este paso durante la semana del 30 del marzo. Mientras tanto, unas familias quien no tienen accesso al servicio internet, pueden encontrar utiles los siguientes recursos en preparacion para lunes, el 6 de abril.
Proveedores de internet que participan en un servicio gratuito:
Comcast/Xfinity (https://www.internetessentials.com)-las familias necesitan aplicar y ser calificado, requisitos similares a SNAP
Spectrum (1-844-488-8395)-servicio internet gratis para alguien con un(os) estudiante(s) k-12 o universitario en su direccion
Acceso Internet de ICS: Tras el lanzamiento de eLearning, ICS ampliara los puntos de acceso WiFi para llegar a varios puntos cerca de cada escuela. Vean abajo para detalles:
ICES: Las familas deberian poder estacionar en los dos carriles del estacionamiento a lo largo del edificio entre la entrada de los grados 3-5 y la entrada del gimnasio para recibir el senal WiFi.

ICMS: Las familias pueden estacionar en los siete o mas lugares de estacionamiento mas cerca del edificio en el estacionamiento pavimentado noroeste detras de las escuela. Acceso a WiFi tambien estara recibido en el area de clase afuera. Por favor, recuerden a respetar la distancia social de seis pies.

IPA: Las familias pueden conectar a WiFi en el estacionamiento del personal suroeste del edificio (cerca de la oficina-la entrada oeste de University). Van a tener un senal mas fuerte mas cerca del edificio. Tambien pueden conectar en el patio, pero respetar la distancia social de seis pies.

Servicio de comida: ICS esta trabajando con el departamento de education de Indiana y nuestro proveedor de servicio de comida, Aramark, para ver si podemos continuar el desayuno y el almuerzo durante las vacaciones primaveras. Si es posible, vamos a mandar noticios tan pronto como sea posible.

Precauciones de COVID-19: Por favor, continuen a monitear la informacion mas actualizado del World Health Organization (WHO) sobre COVID-19 (https://www.who.int/emergencies/diseases/novel-coronavirus-2019).
Noten las precauciones mas importantes abajo como una referencia rapida:
● Se laven las manos regularmente y minuciosamente con desinfectante de manos a base de alcohol o se laven con jabon y aqua caliente.
● Mantengan al menos seis pies de distancia entre ustedes y alguna persona quien esta tosiendo o estornudando. Eviten tocar los ojos, la nariz, o la boca.

● Asegurese de que usted y las personas que lo rodean sigan una bueana higiene respiratoria. Esto significa cubrir la boca y la nariz con el codo o panuelo doblado cuando tosen o estornudan. Luego desechen el tejido usado de inmediato.
● Se queden en casa!
● Si se sienten mal, si tienen una fiebre, tos, o problemas respirar, reciban atencion medicamiento. Necesitan llamar antes de ir.
Por favor, sepa que ustedes y su(s) estudiante(s) son miembros valiosos de nuestra familia ICS. Esperamos comunicacion continua en las proximas semanas. Quedase bien, Ravens!

hr.div: School Updates | March 18, 2020 | 7:30 p.m

div.p: Dear ICS Parents and Guardians – We just completed our two days of Chromebook distribution at all three ICS campuses to those in need of a device. The program went well, thanks to the outstanding response of many our school community members. In these uncertain times, planning for all eventualities is key and the responsibility of us all. Also…we have heard of a number of students and families who are allowing sleep-overs and other similar life-as-usual interactions. We are strongly advising you against such engagements for your children: coronavirus is now a public health crisis, and we are all being forced to change our customs and habits – for the good of the entire community. Please take the necessary precautions so that this unprecedented event can pass as quickly as possible and we can get your children back in school. Finally…“grab and go” breakfast and lunch will be served tomorrow, Thursday, March 19, at IPA for any school student in need. Thanks so much for your time and attention. You are all very important to us. — Tim Mulherin, CEO

hr.p: Queridos padres-Acabamos de completar nuestros dos dias de distribucion de los Chromebooks en cada tres escuelas de ICS para aquellos que necesitan un dispositivo. El programa salio bien, gracias al excelente apoyo y respuest de muchos miembros de nuestra comunidad. En estos tiempos inciertos, ​a planificar todas las eventualidades es clave y la responsibidad de todos. Tamibien…hemos escuchado de varios estudiantes y familias que estan permitiendo “fiestas de pijamas” y otras interacciones de la vida habitual similares. Le recomendamos encarecidamente contra tales compromisos para sus hijos: coronavirus es ahora un crisis de salud publico, y todos estamos siendo obligados a cambiar nuestras costumbres y habitos-por el bien de toda la comunidad. Tome las precauciones necesarias para que este evento sin precedentes pueda pasar lo mas rapido posible y podamos hacer que sus hijos vuelvan a la escuela. Finalmente-el desayuno y almuerzo “grab y go” sera servido manana, jueves, el 19 de marzo en IPA para algun estudiante quien lo necesita. Muchas gracias para su tiempo y atencion. Todos ustedes son muy importantes para nosotros-Tim Mulherin, CEO

hr.div: School Updates | March 16, 2020 | 6:15 p.m

div.span: Thanks to all ICS students and families who came to their schools today to collect Chromebooks and power cords, band instruments, medications, and last-minute items from lockers.
A reminder that TOMORROW (Tuesday, March 17), all three buildings will be open from 2 – 7 p.m. as a final opportunity to retrieve the following:

*CHROMEBOOKS, POWER CORDS — If you already reported that you don’t have an internet-capable device at home in case of eLearning later this semester. (IPA students may also use this opportunity to retrieve their forgotten Chromebook and items from their lockers.)
*FOOD RESOURCE BAG — ICS families in need of non-perishable food items are invited to grab a food resource bag from IPA.
*BAND INSTRUMENTS — if your student left behind their band instrument, please use this opportunity to retrieve it.
STUDENT MEDICATION PICKUP — Parents may pick up medication from the school nurse’s office tomorrow (Tuesday) during the same hours noted above for Chromebook distribution.

FOOD SERVICE — ICS is serving students breakfast and lunch tomorrow through Thursday, March 19. This will be a “drive-through/to-go” service available only at Irvington Preparatory Academy, prepared by our food vendor, Aramark. Breakfast will be served from 7:30 – 8:30 a.m.; lunch from 11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. **PLEASE NOTE that both breakfast and lunch may be picked up in the morning if preferred.
POPCORNOPOLIS FUNDRAISER — Tuesday is the FINAL day to turn in Popcornopolis money and order forms at any of the three school buildings.

Thank YOU for your continued patience and support. And, remember, access to the buildings will be restricted after tomorrow, Tuesday, March 17, so if you need it, you need to come and get it tomorrow.

p.span: Gracias a todos los estudiantes y familias de ICS que vinieron a las escuelas hoy para recoger Chromebooks y cables de alimentación, instrumentos de banda, medicamentos y artículos de último minuto de los casilleros.
Un recordatorio de que MAÑANA (martes 17 de marzo), los tres edificios estarán abiertos de 2 a 7PM como una oportunidad final para recuperar lo siguiente:

* CHROMEBOOKS, CABLES DE ALIMENTACIÓN – sii ya nos informó que no tiene un dispositivo a casa capaz de usar en caso de aprendizaje electrónico más adelante este semestre. (Los estudiantes de IPA también pueden aprovechar esta oportunidad para recuperar sus Chromebook y artículos olvidados de sus casilleros).
* BOLSA DE RECURSOS ALIMENTARIOS: las familias de ICS que necesitan alimentos no perecederos están invitados a tomar una bolsa de recursos alimenticios de IPA.
* INSTRUMENTOS DE BANDA: si su estudiante dejó su instrumento de banda, aproveche esta oportunidad para recuperarlo.

RECOGIDA DE MEDICAMENTOS PARA ESTUDIANTES: los padres pueden recoger los medicamentos de la oficina de la enfermera de la escuela mañana (martes) durante las mismas horas indicadas anteriormente para la distribución de Chromebook.

SERVICIO DE ALIMENTOS: ICS está sirviendo a los estudiantes desayuno y almuerzo desde mañana hasta el jueves 19 de marzo. Este será un servicio “para llevar” disponible solo en Irvington Preparatory Academy, preparado por nuestro vendedor de alimentos, Aramark. span.span:
To: ICS Parents and Staff
From: Irvington Community Schools

On Thursday, March 12, Gov. Eric Holcomb and Mayor Joe Hogsett announced a series of preventative measures aimed at containing the transmission of coronavirus (COVID-19), including the immediate shutdown of all Marion County schools. Given the mayor’s order yesterday, ICS will be closed next week, March 16-20, which is then followed by our two-week spring break.

Here at Irvington Community Schools, the leadership team and staff members have been preparing diligently for a possible shutdown, which suddenly became a reality. The news late yesterday resulted in many cascading events and decisions. Following are several important updates.

: As a key part of our planning, we decided to be prepared to launch eLearning after spring break should a continuation of school shutdowns be extended. Our plan is to distribute Chromebooks to our K-8 families who do not have devices at home, per our survey results. Distribution will take place on Monday, March 16, from 8 a.m. – 1 p.m., and Tuesday, March 17, from 2-7 p.m. The devices will be available for pickup at your child’s respective school. Any IPA students who have need of a Chromebook will also be able to pick up their device on those same days and times. Chromebooks at ICES and ICMS may be picked up by parents and anyone on the designated pickup list for your child(-ren).

i.b: Please note: we will not have eLearning in place next week

span.span: Having devices in students’ hands now will enable us to seamlessly initiate eLearning should the need arise.

Use sanitary wipes only. The wipes should be gently used prior to cleaning the device to reduce the wipe’s moisture content. Do not spray cleaner directly on the Chromebook. Do not use disinfectant on your Chromebook screen. Only clean the keyboard and touch pad.
Parents may pick up medication from the school nurse’s office on Monday and Tuesday during the same hours noted above for Chromebook distribution.

: As you know, ICS has not utilized eLearning previously. In anticipation of a potential coronavirus-influenced school shutdown, we began training for eLearning this week in all three schools. We have worked hard on teacher preparation, outlining student and teacher expectations for a successful eLearning experience. Should there be a continued shutdown of ICS buildings imposed immediately following our Spring break (which concludes on Sunday, April 5), we will begin eLearning for all ICS students, K-12, on Monday, April 6. We will provide plenty of guidance as well as helpdesk contact information to ensure a smooth transition to our eLearning platform, Google Classroom, and the best educational experience for our students outside of the traditional classroom setting.
ICS will allow student work and assessments to be turned in through the end of the first week upon our return from spring break on Monday, April 6. Report cards will be mailed the week of April 13.
All ICS students will be provided the opportunity to receive breakfast and lunch from Monday, March 16, through Thursday, March 19.

i.b: This will be a “drive-through/to-go” service available only at Irvington Preparatory Academy,

span.span: prepared by our food vendor, Aramark. Breakfast will be served from 7:30-8:30 a.m.; lunch from 11:30 a.m. – 12:30 p.m. Please note: both breakfast and lunch may be picked up in the morning if preferred.

Our contracted cleaning crew, under the direction of Jim Miller, ICS Facilities and Maintenance Director, is taking extraordinary measures to clean and disinfect our school buildings in anticipation of reopening on April 6.

There are numerous online public health resources available to you to stay abreast of this rapidly changing situation. We recommend relying on the foremost source of accurate public health information: the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC):
. Meanwhile, please continue to watch for updates from ICS on our Facebook page and through automated email/text messaging/phone delivered by our SwiftK12 mass notification system.

hr.div: Memo
Para: Los padres de ICS y personal de ICS
De: Irvington Community Schools
Re: una actualizacion de nuestra respuesta de Coronavirus
el 13 de marzo, 2020

El jueves, el 12 de marzo, Gov. Eric Holcomb y Mayor Joe Hogsett anunciaron un serie de medidas preventivas destinado a contener la transmision de coronavirus (COVID-19), incluyendo el cierre inmediato de todas las escuelas en Marion County. Por orden del alcalde ayer, ICS estara cerrado la semana que viene, el 16-20 del marzo, que luego se sigue vacaciones de la primavera por dos semanas.

Aqui en Irvington Community Schools, el equipo de liderazgo y personal han estado preparando diligentemente para un cerrado posible, que de repente se hizo realidad. Las noticias del anoche resulto en muchos eventos y decisiones en cascada. A continuacion hay varias actualizaciones importantes.

Distribucion a los Chromebooks: Como parte clave de nuestra planificacion, decidimos estar preparado a iniciar eLearning (clases virtuales) despues de vacaciones primavera si se prolonga la continuacion del cierre de las escuelas. Nuestra plan es para distribuir unos Chromebooks a nuestras familias K-8 quien no tienen dispositivos en casa, por los resultads de nuestra encuesta. La distribuicion tendra lugar el lunes, el 16 del marzo, 8 AM-1 PM, y martes, el 17 del marzo 2 PM-7PM. Los Chromebooks estaran disponible en la escuela adonde asiste el estudiante. Algunos estudiantes de IPA quien necesitan un Chromebook, tambien pueden recogerlo durante los mismos tiempos. Los Chromebooks en ICES y ICMS pueden ser recogido por los padres o alguien en la lista designada de su nino(s). Por favor nota: no vamos a tener eLearning la semana proxima! Si tenemos los Chromebooks con los estudiantes ahors, es mas facil iniciar eLearning en el futuro si necesitamos.

Instrucciones de limpieza para los Chromebooks: Usen solamente toallitas sanitarias. Las toallitas debe usarse antes de limpiar el Chromebook para reducir el contenido de humedad de la toallita. No pueden usar limpiador en aerosol directamente en los Chromebooks. No usen desinfectante en la pantalla. Solamente limpien el teclado.

Recogida de los medicamentos de los estudiantes: Los padres pueden recoger unos medicamentos de la enferemera en cada escuela en la oficina el lunes 16/3/2020 o martes 17/3/2020 durante las mismas horas de la distribucion de Chromebooks.

elearning: Como saben, ICS no ha utilizado eLearning en el pasado. En prevision de un posible cierre de las escuelas para coronavirus, comenzamos a entrenar para e Learning esta semana en las tres escuelas de ICS. Hemos trabajado duro en la preparacion de los maestros, delineando las expectativas de los estudiantes y maestros para exito en la experiencia de eLearning. Si tenemos una continuacion del cierre de las escuelas en ICS despues de vacaciones (el 5 de abril), vamos a empezar eLearning por todos los estudiantes de ICS, K-12 el 6 de abril. Proveeremos demasiado adviso con un “helpdesk” contacto para informacion para asegurar una transicion suave a nuestra programa eLearning, Google Classroom, y la mejor experiencia para nuestros estudiantes.

Las Notas: ICS permitira entregar el trabajo y las evaluaciones de los estudiantes hasta al final de la primera semana despues de regresemos de las vacaciones el 6 de abril. Las cartillas escolares sera enviado por correo la semana del 13 de abril.

Servicio de comida: Todos los estudiantes se le brindara la oportunidad a recibir el desayuno y el almuerzo lunes el 16 de marzo hasta jueves, el 19 de marzo. Este sera un servicio de conduccion solo a Irvington Preparatory Academy. La comida estara preparado de nuestro vendedor Aramark, El desayuno va a servir 7:30 AM-8:30 AM y el almuerzo 11:30 AM-12:30 PM. Nota: Si prefiere, puede escoger el desayuno y el almuerzo al mismo tiempo por la manana.

La limpieza: Nuestro equipo de limpieze contractado, bajo la direccion de Jim Miller, Director de mantenimiento de ICS, esta tomando medidas extraordinarias para limpiar y desinfectar nuestros edificios antes del 6 de abril.

Hay numerosos recursos de salud publica en linea para ustedes para informarle de la situacion Coronavirus. Recomendamos usarle: The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-nCoV/index.html.

div.span: Mientras tanto, por favor continue mirar para actualizaciones de ICS en Facebook, email, mensaje, o por telefono.​

La recaudacion de fondos para ICS de Popcornopolis oficialmente termino hoy, viernes, el 13 de marzo. Estamos preguntando que todas las familias quien participaron a entregar las formas y el dinero a la oficina de Irvington Preparatory Academy (5751 E. University Ave) uno de los siguientes dos dias:

ICS staff has worked tirelessly this week developing an eLearning plan to establish an appropriate digital learning environment to meet student needs and achieve academic goals without sacrificing our school’s mission and beliefs. This plan is complete and teachers are trained.

Given the Governor’s recent declaration of a 20-day waiver on required school days, we have decided to take today, Friday, March 13, and all of next week, to close all three schools with no eLearning while our staff continues to refine the program.

div.p: In the event we need to launch eLearning on the back end of spring break, our program will be robust and our instructional output will be as close to our traditional instructional model as possible. Please stay tuned for additional updates from us before the end of the day.

p.strong: Comunicación de aprendizaje electrónico de ICS | 3/13/20 (10:45 am)

hr.p: El personal de ICS ha trabajado incansablemente esta semana desarrollando un plan de aprendizaje electrónico para establecer un entorno de aprendizaje digital apropiado para satisfacer las necesidades de los estudiantes y alcanzar los objetivos académicos sin sacrificar la misión y las creencias de nuestra escuela. Este plan está completo y los maestros son capaz. Dada que el Gobernador ha anunciado una reducción de 20 días en los días escolares requeridos, hemos decidido tomar hoy, viernes 13 de marzo, y toda la próxima semana, cerrar las tres escuelas sin aprendizaje electrónico mientras nuestro personal continúa refinando el programa. En caso de que necesitemos lanzar eLearning al final de las vacaciones de primavera, nuestro programa será robusto y nuestra producción de instrucción estará lo más cerca posible de nuestro modelo de instrucción tradicional. Estén atentos para recibir actualizaciones adicionales antes del final del día.
